posts.content:
As seen here: pw-adapted-special-build-needed-t2354962.html, I was previously trying to find something that I could solo my current PW with. My problem is that the monsters are set up so you can't solo, with excessive AC/AB bonuses and tons of immunities.

Now that I've gotten a few tips and hints, I'm wondering. Is a monk relevant? As far as I can tell, you can make yourself a fairly untouchable monk by going dex/wis/tumble and cranking up the AC. Only trouble is that you'll end up with someone with extremely high AC (unhittable), but with low AB (not gonna hit nothing). So, what about a Monk/WM? I tried looking a bit but only found a very few builds which focussed more on cool stuff like max attacks/SR and such. How would a monk build look like if you want BOTH high AC and high AB and prioritize accordingly?

Any tips? Please?

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
I think I know this:
DEX is better than STR in a high-magic world (since you don't need those extra damage points).
WM is best at 7 unless you maximize it.
Fighter is used to give some more feats, usually stays at 12 or so.
Monk more than 21 does not really add anything to the build, except occasional AC bumps and more speed than you need.
Kama is usually better than gloves in a high-magic world (where you can build +20AB and +4d6 magic weapons).
More hits is not always that good, since the monsters have so high AC that you only hit them with your first couple of attacks.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Monk is always good! Sorry, bit of a fan. Before handing you over to Empyre for proper guidance, it might be worth mentioning that Monk's AB progression with kamas (and fists) is -3, rather than everyone else's -5, so you will definitely stand a better than average chance of hitting outside your first flurry. Also, if you dual-wield kamas (you'll have to work out which other class suits you, but 9 levels of Ranger gives you Imp 2-Weapon Fighting for free) you can get up to 10 attacks p/round. So don't dismiss it.

Admittedly, Dex-based Monks will largely be chipping away rather than flattening, but any hit can disrupt spell-chuckers.

If Empyre doesn't come back to you (particularly with one of his 100 or so excellent Order of the Wyrm builds), I'm happy to offer amateur advice!

Cheers

More attacks might be useful after all. If you are only hitting on a 20, you have more attempts to get that 20. Also, with the Monk attack progression, each attack is -3 AB instead of the -5 you would have otherwise.

A build with lots of Pale Master would give you the best AC, while a build with lots of WM would give you the best melee AB. For a good balance between the two, I recommend a Fighter / Bard / RDD. Ten levels of RDD gives you +8 STR to help with your AB and also gives you +4 AC.

Alright, it's very simple to find the number of attacks from the BAB number.
If it is a level 40 build then you subtract 10 and then the number left indicates the number of attacks as well.

Up to 10 BAB: 2 attacks (lowest it can go).
Up to 15 BAB: 3 attacks (typical cleric, rogue, monk etc)
Up to 20 BAB: 4 attacks (typical multi-class one of the above with a warrior class, or a pure warrior)

After that, Monks are a special case when they use their fists or kamas only (or their claws if they are in dragon shape).
The short answer is that they always add plus 2 attacks to the base BAB number and those attacks also come with -3 iterations instead of -5 that the rest have.
For example, pure Monk is 15 BAB then 25 BAB for a level forty build. Instead of having 3 attacks, when he uses his fists or kamas he has 3+2=5 attacks.
Those attacks will follow a -3 iteration pattern as well, meaning more will hit, on average.
Lastly, there is also the option of "Flurry" that a Monk gains one more attack but ALL of them take -2 to their AB, which is commonly referred to, as "Flurry of Misses".

About the gloves, that's too bad man.
Proper Monks (Martial Monks that is) already get cheated of potentially two equipment slots (bracers, shield) and usually, the gloves are better than regular weapons to compensate for that reason, but those enchantments are worse instead.
Some PW's & Modules such as WoG, Aielund & MotS do have special equipment for them but most don't.
